head.title: The Get: Top Shelf; Pouring In London

hedline.hl1: The Get: Top Shelf; Pouring In London

abstract.p: Roundup of smart London lounges, noting cocktails they serve; photos (M)

block.p: The city might be famous for its pubs, but these days you're more likely to see locals sipping cocktails in a sleek lounge. Cutting-edge concoctions abound, but so does respect for early cocktail history. (Strangely popular is the Martinez, the proto-martini -- gin, sweet vermouth and orange bitters -- which dates back to the California gold rush.) Here are five places to start the night, one for every taste.

The Dukes Hotel Bar The discreet home (top right) of the perfect martini: ice-cold Plymouth gin (poured tableside into a frozen glass), a splash of vermouth and a twist. Olives, if you must, come on the side. 35 St. James Place, SW1A 1NY; 011-44-020-7491-4840.
Lab Bar Loud music, loud cocktails of the muddled-fresh-fruit variety. 12 Old Compton Street, W1D 4TQ; 011-44-020-7437-7820.
Match One of the first serious cocktail bars in London and still one of the best. Not flashy, just a laid-back spot with incredible drinks. 37-38 Margaret Street, W1G OJF; 011-44-020-7499-3443.
Montgomery Place This seemingly unassuming watering hole (bottom) serves spot-on drinks to the Notting Hill glitterati. 31 Kensington Park Road, W11 2EU; 011-44-020-7792-3921.
Trailer Happiness The fine selection of umbrella drinks is improbably tasteful. 177 Portobello Road, W11 2DY; 011-44-020-7727-2700.
